Messages of Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister and For. Minister
articles.content:
Messages of Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister and For. Minister 
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Hun Sen, prime minister of the royal government of Cambodia, on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to develop on good terms, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work.    
 Meanwhile, Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Hor Nam Hong, minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia.

DPRK Delegations Leave for Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Delegations Leave for Different Countries
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Kim Yong Il today left Pyongyang to visit China.
 Meanwhile, a delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League led by Secretary Jang Yong Chol left here for Laos.

Kim Il Chol Meets Indonesian Defence Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol Meets Indonesian Defence Ministry Delegation
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Vice-Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Defence Ministry of Indonesia headed by Maj. General Sudrajat, director general for Defence Strategy, on Monday.  Present were generals and officers of the KPA and the Indonesian ambassador e. p. to the DPRK.
 On the occasion the head of the delegation said that the friendly and cooperative relations between Indonesia and the DPRK are developing day by day and expressed the belief that the relations would grow stronger in the future, too.
